Basic details: Margaret Green, a 70-year-old female, presents to the clinic with neck pain.
Vitals:
BP: 140/80 mm Hg
Temp: 98.4°F (36.9°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 78/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sit upright in the chair and occasionally rub the back of your neck.
Exhibit limited range of motion when asked to turn your head side to side.
If asked about any recent injuries, mention a minor fall a few weeks ago but no immediate pain afterwards.
If X-ray or MRI is mentioned by the examinee, ask, “What will that show?”
Challenging question: “Could this neck pain be something serious like cancer or a stroke?”
